meanings.definition: Excessive control or restriction by rules or laws.
meanings.sent1: The overregulation of small businesses can hinder their growth and innovation.
meanings.sent2: The government's overregulation of the industry led to decreased competition.
meanings.sent3: The overregulation of lemonade stands made the kids fill out endless paperwork.
meanings.sent4: The overregulation suffocated the creativity of the artists, stifling their expression.
meanings.sent5: The overregulation felt like a heavy weight pressing down on the entrepreneurs' shoulders.

meanings.definition: The act of regulating too strictly or excessively.
meanings.sent1: Overregulation in the education system can limit teachers' flexibility in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The consequences of overregulation in the financial sector can be detrimental to the economy.
meanings.sent3: The overregulation of pet grooming services resulted in mandatory hourly fur inspections.
meanings.sent4: The overregulation poured cold water on the enthusiasm of the new business owners.
meanings.sent5: The overregulation acted like a strict parent, constantly monitoring every move of the industry.
